tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE robot_sensor_data (
    sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_type VARCHAR(50),
    sensor_value FLOAT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE sensor_logs (
  log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  sensor_id INT,
  log_message VARCHAR(255),
  created_at TIMESTAMP,
  FOREIGN KEY (sensor_id) REFERENCES robot_sensors(sensor_id)
);

CREATE TABLE Robot (id INT PRIMARY KEY,
name VARCHAR,
sensor1 INT,
sensor2 INT);

CREATE TABLE SensorData (id INT PRIMARY KEY,
sensor_id INT,
timestamp TIMESTAMP,
value FLOAT);

CREATE TABLE Engineer (id INT PRIMARY KEY,
name VARCHAR,
role VARCHAR,
experience INT);

CREATE TABLE Sensor (
    sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    sensor_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    robot_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (robot_id) REFERENCES Robot(robot_id)
);

CREATE TABLE SensorData (
    data_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_id INT,
    collected_date TIMESTAMP,
    value DOUBLE,
    FOREIGN KEY (sensor_id) REFERENCES Sensor(sensor_id)
);

CREATE TABLE EngineerLog (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    engineer_id INT,
    action VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    log_date TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (engineer_id) REFERENCES Engineer(engineer_id)
);

CREATE TABLE Robot (id INT PRIMARY KEY,
name TEXT,
model TEXT,
manufacturer TEXT);

CREATE TABLE Sensor (id INT PRIMARY KEY,
type TEXT,
range TEXT,
resolution TEXT);

CREATE TABLE Location (id INT PRIMARY KEY,
latitude DECIMAL(9,6),
longitude DECIMAL(9,6),
altitude DECIMAL(6,2));

CREATE TABLE DataLog (id INT PRIMARY KEY,
sensor_id INT,
location_id INT,
timestamp TIMESTAMP,
value DECIMAL);

CREATE TABLE Analysis (id INT PRIMARY KEY,
sensor_id INT,
location_id INT,
analysis_type TEXT,
result TEXT);
